channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Persistent flooding because drain is at HIGH ground, 4th August
item.description:
First reported in January 2025. This area floods every time it rains because the drains are not at low ground. The drains have been installed on high ground. During term time hundreds of children cross here twice a day. To avoid the flooding and related spray, families stand in the cycle path. This is going to cause an accident involving children getting hit by a bike because the drains were not installed at low ground and the area floods. GCC assured me in February 2025 this would be fixed: "Following post-construction inspections, the team has identified that remedial work is necessary at this location to correct the levels. We plan to address this issue during the installation of the footpath extension and gully repositioning, which are part of the ongoing cycleway expansion project. We anticipate completing these improvements and remedial work by the end of spring 2025." The construction crew was at this site for 6 months and did NOT fix the issue. Now they are gone and it has not been remediated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Central Cross Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A tree in the grass verge has been identified by a Sky investigating technician as blocking a satellite signal to our receiver dish on our property., 4th August
item.description:
The tree 's upper foilage ( almost certainly grown higher than anticipated when originally planted ), impairs the transmission of the TV signal,worsening in the past 2-3 years. It is situated in Colesbourne Rd ,adjacent to the corner house in Robert Burns Avenue,approximately 30 metres from that road.Brashing of the upper branches is the only remedy according to the assessment by Sky.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Colesbourne Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes on Corner going uo Aggs Hill and past Lower Laynes Farm, 4th August
item.description:
At the location - several potholes on the left hand side going up the hill forces vehicles to move to the right on what is a partialy blind bend. The side of the road is also eroded which also causes a problem when 2 vehicles meet. Please can these be filled in.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discarded black wheelie bin, 4th August
item.description:
On the corner of Arle gardens and alstone lane outside 125 alstone lane. Rubbish and a black wheelie bin have been discarded for a week it is now being blown around the street in the high winds.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Arle Gardens, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Popular footpath is blocked by 6ft maize, 4th August
item.description:
Two fields of maize has made path impassable. The height of the crop and density means one cannot follow the path and is blocked in two fields.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rushley Lane, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
